main event: Residents of Hazard, Kentucky reported sighting a metallic object west of the sun that had been observed for several weeks.
interesting points: The object was described as moving as a 'solid body' that retained its position relative to the sun.
The object was estimated to be approximately 30 degrees west of the sun.
Dr. Hynek suggested the object was likely the planet Venus, which was highly visible west of the sun at the time.
Weather conditions could have caused an apparent increase in the size of Venus during daylight hours.
The observers were advised that they were likely seeing the planet Venus and were encouraged to try and take a photograph of the object using a high-powered telescope.
result: Probable explanation: The object was the planet Venus
sighted object: Metallic object west of the sun
photographs: No, the report does not contain any photographs
